website_summaries.verdict: Relatively quiet running air impact wrench that still delivers nice power levels. Easy to operate.
pros: Handle features an ergonomic design that helps prevent fatigue in the wrists and forearms while using it
Air exhaust routes through bottom of handle to keep it out of operator's face
Offers an impressive 1,295 ft-lbs of torque
Surprising amount of power considering how quietly it operates
cons: May not stand up to tough conditions during continuous use, eventually breaking down

customer_reviews.title: Your New Favorite Impact Wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. Unless you are working for Terex, this tool should be your favorite everyday wrench. It's solid, light, comfortable, quiet, and powerful. It gets the job done, even on a smaller compressor. I've been using a pneumatic impact for 25 years, and this is my pick at this price. I especially appreciate the low impact option for F, just enough torque to install but light enough so you can still put the torque wrench on. Enjoy this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Torque for tough jobs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the BOMB!!!!!!!!!! Unbelievable torque to the point where we bent a ratchet we put on the end of it to remove these bolts. Definitely worth the extra money from the standard 200-300 lbs of torque 9-14-18 Follow up....still the bomb. Brake Caliper bolts that no other gun could move and it went instantly. Don't wast your money on other name brands, this one is the best I've seen in a factory setting or working on cars.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS IMPACT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I've been working in shops for 4 years. This thing is reliable as heck! Its light, powerful, quiet, powerful, and only costs $170 Did I say this thing is powerful? I worked on lots of semis! When I couldnt bust lug nuts off with the 1" gun we had, I grabbed this thing at it would work everytime! Just buy it already.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Peterson

customer_reviews.title: IR or NitroCat- get both. This gun is one of the best around.
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to leave bad review because the gun is awesome I bought two but the one I got from amazon had an issue with the hole that you screw the air plug into keeps spinning, anyone else have this issue? I thought that it was reverse thread to tighten but it just kept turning. But I do own one and it's SICK can't wait to get into it. this is nicer fit and better sounding than the IR but I do like both. Anyone deciding between this and the IR you can't go wrong with either but I've used the IR 231 and that thing is a beast!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It did not work as expected for me.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work as expected for me. I could not remove all the lugs of my 2017 Escalade, I was only able to remove some lug nuts on some wheels and I had to use a breaker bar to pull out the rest. I didn't feel a big difference in power between my old iR air gun and this one. I have a new compressor and its set @125 PSI so don't think its an air supply issue.
customer_reviews.author: J>A.

customer_reviews.title: Strongest gun in the shop
customer_reviews.text: The twin clutch mechanism acts differently than a twin hammer, but seems to be just as reliable. Have been oiling regularly with leftover 5W30 synthetic motor oil instead of air tool oil. Stronger gun than any snap-on 1/2" in the shop. 1300ft lbs of torque still seem to be a high guess. I would estimate closer to 700-800ft lbs. Definitely one of the best guns available for the price. Sometimes wish I had picked the 1150 for the twin hammer system, but this setup has been working flawlessly for a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Red Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful piece of equipment. Not sure about the long term.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it for long, but from what I've seen it is an extremely powerful tool for the money. A bit bulky but what can you expect for 1200 ft of torque? It is quite quiet for the power. The packaging it comes in makes you feel like the company stands behind its products 110% percent. Plus this is cheaper than other air impacts with similar or less power. Cons: brushed metal tip scratches easy. So be sure to get a cover for it. Bulky, so don't expect to use this in tight areas. Heavy, but I'm sure this is to be expected. Really hope this stands up to IR for the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Slowmoe

customer_reviews.title: Solid Air Impact Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is the best impact wrench I own. It makes the IR unit a piece of junk. Sockets are easy to put on, they stay on and are easy to take off. I like the way I can dial the pressure needed in either direction. I can see why NHRA crews use it.
customer_reviews.author: Francis X. Fanucci

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and strong
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say anything about long term use only had this for one day but seems nicely built took off three axle nuts four sets of wheels and it never hesitated or seemed to struggle once very quiet I was skeptical about it in the add hammering metal is loud no matter what so I thought I was wrong lol as long as it holds up I’m very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Only ussd a few times so far , quiter than thought it would be , develops powes to take off nuts faster than my other impacts . I do use hi flow air air fittings to improve how much air come in the gun
customer_reviews.author: johns69ply1

customer_reviews.title: Shut up and buy it
customer_reviews.text: I'm a master mechanic and use my tools 6 days a week and put them through their worst conditions. I will stress that I have over 100k in tools and this gun is equal to my 500 dollar Mac tools 1/2 inch. Don't be afraid to buy it. It is a composite housing so don't drop it. If you drop your tools like an idiot then opt for a steel or aluminum housing gun. Also install a water separator for your compressor to extend tool life. Using proper air tool oil never trans fluid like some people is a bad idea. But hey what do I know.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Macleod

customer_reviews.title: Best impact i have used. Powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new impact for some time now and bought this one because of the great reviews. First use was to drive 24 inch anchors into the ground. This wrench did it with no problem. My big 1/2 inch electric drill could not get the job done. Have not had any bolt or nut this impact wrench did not break loose easily ,would gladly buy again, i give it 5 stars for power.
customer_reviews.author: Billy H Davis

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It got the axle shaft nuts off my Dodge that were torqued to 180 ftlbs. And it got the ones that had been rusted for 17 years off. For what it is it does a great job. Does it have super human strength? No but it will pop the lug nuts that are tq'ed to 120 ft lbs all day long. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: JTWJR

customer_reviews.title: The best impact in 1/2" on market under $500 hands down
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful. It will snap 3/8” SHCS like twigs. Also they advertise 1295ft.lbs of loosening torque. This is the initial reverse burst that only counts for the first few hits. The standard 900ft lbs is the constant rating. Every impact has a initial Burst of power and this is when a bolt will break free best. So if u get a tough bolt to break. Get on and off the trigger it helps. Also eliminate any in needed extension as the absorb power and will not work as good. My work only has 85psi and it’s still a monster. At home at 115psi it’s crazy!!
customer_reviews.author: Pitty

customer_reviews.title: works great in heavy truck shop.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a welder for a trash company, frequently I have to work on the trucks as well, take things apart fix what snapped then reassemble. I've used dozens of different impacts out there, and the only thing ive seen that beats this is the 1 inch drive tire gun. The other mechanic's fancy 2 paycheck snap-on guns can't beat it, the 3/4 drive IR gun cant even loosen stuff this gun has tightened (impacts develop most torque in reverse). It does torque the wrist pretty hard so be careful if you have sticks for arms. It's also TONS quieter than any other gun I've used.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: It fits comfortable in your hand and has a nice balanced feel
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Can yo feel the power. This gun is an absolute dream. It fits comfortable in your hand and has a nice balanced feel. Did I mention the power? I used this working on my 2012 International Prostar to remove a couple of frame bolts that I couldn't budge with my older gun. This took the right off with no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buying expert

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am a dealership technician and have had this impact for a while now and here are my thoughts: PROS: Quiet Smooth Very good trigger, lots of modularity Strong Cons: Not super powerful, but still plenty strong for most applications The impact is longer than some others so some suspension components are impossible to use this with This has a seal on the nose cone that is leaking after moderate use. The leak is so bad I am tempted to return it. All in all, this gun is a good candidate but there are better ones on the market for a similar value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Love this gun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun nearly 2 years ago and it is still going strong. I love how quite it is and the power output is amazing! This thing will out due snap-on half inch guns easily. I use it on 1and1/4" bolts all the time. About the only down side is that it snaps off smaller bolts very easily so you have to be careful. I have a co-worker that has had the 1100k for 4 years and has beat it to death and it still works great. He has used it to loosen lug nuts on volvo articulating hual trucks which are torqued to well over 500 foot pounds. Best gun for the money hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Sean K.

customer_reviews.title: Use it and guidance to the way that it's supposed to be used and oil it every usage
customer_reviews.text: I work professionally in the trade and I use this thing for all my needs on any nut and bolt that I cannot remove by wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Dave & Annie Miller

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with my hub assembly replacement on my GMC 2500. It effortlessly removed my 36mm axle nut. It is pretty darn quiet too. I was borrowing a friends $50 husky and this tool was noticeably quieter, it is almost deceiving because you would think something so quiet couldn't possibly have this much power. I am driving it with a harbor freight compressor which can push 4-5scfm at 90 and a 3/8" ID hose.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This impact has a lot of power. This is a top quality product. You won't be disappointed. It's made my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McQuait

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I was between this and the IR 2135TiMAX. I went with this because it was $100 cheaper. A few guys at work have the 2135TiMAX and love them. Here is the scoop. Nitrocat makes much less noise than the Ingersoll Rand. The Nitrocat weighs a considerable amount more than the Ingersoll Rand. They are both extremely strong. No one has ran into a situation where the Nitrocat could break loose a bolt that the IR couldn't, or vice versa. If I had the choice again, I would make the same decision due to Nitrocat being considerably cheaper and the quietness of the Nitrocat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Sweet tool
customer_reviews.text: I mean -- YEAH -- perfect for my garage (2013 Mercedes-Benz GKL350, 2011 Chevrolet Camaro / Edelbrock 600 HP, 2014 Kawasaki Ninja 1000 ABS). the NitroCat is simply awesome and I am afraid I have a better tool than I really need. Just couldn't help it. I got an average home air compressor with tank and it's delivering more than enough power to this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Detail Obsessed Skunk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband because he was in need of an air impact. When he told the guys at work that his wife purchased him a Nitrocat for Valentine's day, my fan base doubled in size. This brand is amazing and it's really hard to find quality items like this running so cheap. We would recommend this durable brand and well-built product to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: HamburgerHelper

customer_reviews.title: One real tool for a mechanic
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a mac impact with 1000 ftlb in reverse but it broke. I tried craftman regular impact and them the professional one but they didnt last and werent powerful enough so i bought this one: its working really good. Super quiet and strong. I know the difference between impact guns because i am a mechanic and my coworkers have "best brands" but nor as strong and super noisy. This one meet my expectations and im very happy with it. I will buy more when i need them.
customer_reviews.author: Gabino

customer_reviews.title: Lookin good so far.
customer_reviews.text: was sold on NitroCat by my Mac Tools guy. Gave the 3/8 impact a try (1355-XL) I hope the twin clutch works on this guy.Not sure if I want to take these guys to work or just keep um home. Scrap yard tear-down is hard on all the tools. Fast passed, dirty environment, in and outa the weather.Think I'll keep this one home, at least till I need one at work.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: First Choice for a Good Impact Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Much more quiet than my current impact wrench. Much more powerful as well. Additionally, I saw this as lightweight compared to my current impact wrench. I would purchase this again, and wish I would have purchased this to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This air wrench has good torque. Hang on. I use it a lot in shop. I find myself grabbing it over the others. My brother had one to
customer_reviews.author: DelvinNolt

customer_reviews.title: Over 900 ft lbs of TORQUE
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like NASCAR, looks like NASCAR, approved by NASCAR. I use this EVERYDAY and hasn't failed me yet. If you are sick of those 750 ft lbs of torque impact guns that just can't remove a lug nut, then you have to get the hammer and breaker bar out just to loosen that lug nut.... Not with this bad boy impact. Never had a lug nut it wouldn't remove.
customer_reviews.author: Just for Fun

customer_reviews.title: Had a stuck 1 1/16" water heater anode bolt. ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a stuck 1 1/16" water heater anode bolt. Could not break it loose with s 24" breaker bar but when I put the Nitrocat to work it broke that bolt head loose 3 seconds after I pulled the trigger. I am impressed. Where have you been my whole life?
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: Yea. This airtool is no joke. Used it today and experimented at 90 to 125kbr. On bolts. It's a animal alright. Careful. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I have only had this tool about a month, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this tool about a month , but what a time saver. It makes work of taking off lug nuts off a gooseneck trailer in just seconds as opposed to using hand ratchet. Nut size is 1"1/16 and it does it no problem. I have only used lowest of three possible tightening settings but still produces quite a torque. After reading reviews on half inch guns I decided to go with aircat. I wanted something American made plus they also offer heavier air guns at great prices . I will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This impact gun definitely performs as advertised. I used high flow fittings to ensure full capacity. The one bolt I needed it for came right off is seconds. Well made and ergonomic. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ronaround

customer_reviews.title: great commercial grade gun same as Mac tools version.
customer_reviews.text: great gun !! i purchased this gun because this company makes the air guns for mac tools and i had the mac version of this gun and it was the greatest air gun but it broke twice on me .being said it is about 10 years old .so i wanted to replace it but didnt want to spend 500-600 dollars on an other mac one so i got the same gun in the company that makes macs and it is great just what i expected !!! very powerful and quiet .
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Y.

customer_reviews.title: The Lion!!
customer_reviews.text: This "machine" is very powerful and more than that, Quite. The other reviews about the noise level is spot on. Only thing that makes the noise is the hammer. The form fitted handle however, is a tad annoying. I have normal size hands and they don't fit the handle perfectly. Still a Great buy and so quite I nicknamed it the Assassin. Forgetting about the NitroCat, I have since nicknamed it the Lion. So powerful and quite. Worth every cent and then some
customer_reviews.author: LordByron

customer_reviews.title: NICE POWERFUL GUN WITH A DECENT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS GUN FOR WORK, I AM A MASTER TECH AND USE THIS GUN EVERY DAY DURING THE WEEK, WORKS VERY WELL AND IT IS VERY QUIET.
customer_reviews.author: Guenther

customer_reviews.title: So far this thing has been great. Used it several times thinking it would break ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing has been great. Used it several times thinking it would break the bolt off before the seized nut would come off. Buzzed them off with out much hesitation. Im highly impressed with this thing as compared to other $75-$150 ranged impacts I have used. I'd recommend this over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lorensen

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Had no problem with wheel or suspension bolts. Solid deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong gun that is quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I like to brag around the shop saying i have the most powerful gun. And its the quietest! when somebody has a tough to break bolt, i show up and take it off usually with no problems. And its at half the price of snap-on and similar brands with the same tough quality, have been using everyday for the past few months and have no problems and no loss of power.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainZoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome impact, I work in diesel repair shop and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome impact, I work in diesel repair shop and mainly use the impact on split rim trailer tire changes, this gun will bust loose rusted lug nuts with ease. Just a great product and price, highly recommend the NitroCat!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Irvin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I lived without it!
customer_reviews.text: GReat if I am too far from the air compressor Especially great working on my John Deere.
customer_reviews.author: A E BUZZ JEHLE

customer_reviews.title: I have a Dewalt cordless impact that is rated at 300ft/lbs and it seems like that thing can take off rusty bolts that this ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, either mine was broken out of the box (I fully lubed it according to the directions) or it is far weaker than it says it is. I have a Dewalt cordless impact that is rated at 300ft/lbs and it seems like that thing can take off rusty bolts that this one cant, even though its rated FAR higher. I have a big air compressor so that isn't the issue. Honestly very disappointed, $170 down the drain honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This impact is a bad as* and not even just for the money. Bought it because of the reviews, and it actually placed second out of a selection of 50 top impacts. I use it on big rigs and trailers, and it gives my 1" Ingersoll Rand a run for it's money.
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Trickett

customer_reviews.title: Great for Automotive Work, Great Torque!
customer_reviews.text: After buying an electric Dewalt impact gun and returning it, I picked one of these up. Took the lugs off my durango no problem. Wheel bearing nut no problem. Greatest air tool I have purchased, everything I have thrown it at it it has taken care of. Highly recommended! Check out there fb page for the difference between the 2 models they sell.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Definitely cheaper than the truck
customer_reviews.text: Very strong and very quiet. I am a professional mechanic and it gets used on a daily basis
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my bus mechanic. He said he ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my bus mechanic. He said he didn't think it would be able to install lugs nuts on bus tires because a 1/2 inch air impact wrench wouldn't have enough power. He had been taking our buses to a shop that had a 1 inch wrench. I told him to try it anyway, and now he is all smiles.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. James

customer_reviews.title: If you want a gun that is powerful and sturdy then this is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: This is one product that I say does what it claims to do . This gun will fasten and unfasten lug nuts with no problem. I was not sure it would be as powerful but it meet my highest of expectations . If you want a gun that is powerful and sturdy then this is the one to buy..
customer_reviews.author: J. L

customer_reviews.title: i was able to removed the same lugnuts with easy.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 stars only because after 2 yaers of slight used during the summer months, the gun is having prolems with removing lugnuts that are only tight to 70 lbs. When I first got it, i was able to removed the same lugnuts with easy.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: awesome power.
customer_reviews.text: great gun, quiet, lightweight, it does the job 100%, i would and have put this up to a Snap-On MG725 and this wins. great power, nice trigger, the 3/8 Air cat gun trigger is horrible, this one is perfect. no complaints, it can take lugs off a Mack CH613 with a bit of a struggle, takes out the infamous 19mm honda crank pulley bolt without much work. it is MUCH quieter than any other 1/2 gun except maybe the IR TI QT model. Tip: if you can use the bigger 3/8 air fittings USE THEM, it LOVES lots of air, and it makes a difference, gains about 15-20% more FT/LB with the bigger fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Granata

customer_reviews.title: Super impact
customer_reviews.text: This impact is a monster. I used it to tighten a nut that had a washer under it and the hole under the washer was a little large this tool punched the washer through the hole with no resistanc. It can do damage if your not careful
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. My last one lasted for 6 years before needing replacement. Very good buy for this product since it lasts as long as it does.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome impact gun
customer_reviews.text: Awesome impact gun. On the lowest setting, torques lug nuts well over 140 ft lbs. Hasn't tore up any sockets with the anvil. I'm a GM tech and looks 99% a match to the Mac tools impact gun.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Spalla

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Professional Auto Service Tech. 30+ years working on cars and trucks. This gun simply has the most bang for the buck period. Quiet and powerful. Be careful when tightening bolts, snapped off an M8 stud the first time I used it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lesa J. Wathen

customer_reviews.title: WOW...This thing is powerful and quiet!!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times but I can say that this thing blows my other brand name Impact gun out of the water...Zips lug nuts off like no other...I had to remove a shock bolt that was torqued to 425 ft lbs and this thing easily took it off...where my other impact just sputtered. I highly recommend this Impact wrench!!
customer_reviews.author: John Wayne Rules

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is the most powerful impact I have owned. I have stump grinder teeth that I have to use a breaker bar and a pipe on. This cracks them loose. I hope you have a strong wrist. you'll need it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful gun... a little noisy, but does the job. Diesel mechanic for over 20 years. Don’t waste money on a Snap-On or Ingersal Rand when this fun is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: So I just received this awesome impact wrench. It uses way less air than most for the price. I had 3 lug nuts on my truck that wouldn't buge with a 4 way or my buddies snap on MG725, Which states it maxes out with about 1190 ftlb of torque. It costs $459 and I only paid $165 for the nitro. The nitro took them right off. I'm real satisfied with it. For the money you just can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: kkrb1985

customer_reviews.title: Impressive tool!
customer_reviews.text: Planned to buy IR Titanium, but selected this instead based on reviews on Amazon and elsewhere. Replaces my very old Rodac. Far less $ than IR, and works GREAT on the toughest bolts I've found so far. Smooth, effortless, far less vibration than my old wrench. Gives the sensation that nothing is hard. A bit slower than other wrenches, but no more than a couple of seconds or so on a tight lug nut. The loosening power is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 inch impact wrench
customer_reviews.text: I work as an Auto Tech. in the Northeast US and we use lots of salt in the winter so I have lots of rusted bolts to deal with. The power is simply amazing! It's lightweight and quiet. Snow tire changeover you have it in your hand a lot and the light weight is really nice. You have to try one! Simply the best
customer_reviews.author: Ken Wickert

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power
customer_reviews.text: Used this NitroCat 1200 to removed the lung nuts on my farm tractor. This model had more than enough power to handle the job. This is a must have. I also own the Aircat 3/8 1300. It struggled to remove the lug nuts and was unable to remove some of them. I would recommend the NitroCat 1200-k impact wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: i have used this impact for 2 weeks and i am very impressed with the performance of this impact versus my snap on titanium which cost me more than double. i will review this again in 6 mo. to test the performance over time. i bought it as a second and it rates as a first quality impact. i have been an auto mechanic for over 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Go Wrong Buying One of These
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for over 3 years now personally and it it top of the line. I run a mechanic shop, so as appreciation gifts I purchased 2 of these for a couple of my techs. Absolutely one of the best, most powerful, and quiet 1/2 impacts on the market.
customer_reviews.author: cbsdiesel

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far very good. Stronger than my same size/price/quality Ingersal and CP
customer_reviews.author: I always wait to review

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !! Would purchase again !!
customer_reviews.text: Been Awesome so far . Super strong and keeps on taking a beating ... Highly Recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: John Kochevar

customer_reviews.title: Simple awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Crazy powerful, crazy quiet, crazy awesome! I use this with my 10 year old Craftsman air compressor and it works perfectly fine. From changing tires to removing leaf springs, this thing will get the job done. One reverse settings and 3 forward, I've only ever needed to use the lowest forward setting. Love this thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This gun has more power than my Harbor freight 3/4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This gun has more power than my Harbor freight 3/4 gun and it was less money. Seems to be constructed well. If you use it a lot your going to get a raw spot on your thumb joint from the way the grip is formed.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: wish I had bought this years ago. It's the strongest gun in the shop, and it's quiet! I'm a 30 year mechanic with a lot of hearing loss due to prolonged exposure to air tool noise. If you are looking for a tool you are going to work with day in and out, don't underestimate the long term benefit of a tool that won't make you deaf. As I mentioned earlier, it also has impressive torque. Crankshaft bolts are the test of any impact gun, and so far this gun is undefeated.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Higley

customer_reviews.title: 😁👍
customer_reviews.text: Woohoo woooooo woooooo woooooo woohoo yeeeeeeeeeeehawwwww. Great price and to top it off great feel great torque. Pluses it is a standard lender at my cities local Toyota dealership. Not meant for heavy duty but works on old busted rusted pickups awwww snap. 😁 🚙 🚗
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I am an auto mechanic and use this airgun a lot each day. I love the feel of it, along with the power. Downside is, it has broken down for me one after just a little over a year. I shipped back for repairs, and they did do a quick repair, and was back in my tool box pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dale I. T

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this purchase. Had a crank bolt that wouldn't budge at all with my other 1/2" impact. This one took it off like it was already loose. Very happy to have this impact.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love me some POWER!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. Bought it to work on sons 1965 truck. Just normal garage use. Spent a little more than just a wal-mart or home improvement cheapy- which aren't all that cheap any more. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Sewell

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to take off a suspension bolt. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take off a suspension bolt. It is really quite, but it did not take off the bolt, I have bought new shallow sockets in the hopes that solves the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Woo

customer_reviews.title: Husband (and adult son) love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what I was purchasing for my husband's Christmas gift, so I asked my son for advice. He made some suggestions, so I looked them up online. They all looked good, but when comparing prices, I found the NitroCat impact wrench on Amazon at a lower price. My husband couldn't believe how well made it is and can't wait to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Redsox-fan

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Won't buy any other impact again. The got me hooked on these
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Vandergriff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: 4 years of use and abuse it still works great
customer_reviews.author: E Barnes

customer_reviews.title: This gun is amazing! I've been working on cars and trucks for ...
customer_reviews.text: This gun is amazing! I've been working on cars and trucks for over 20 years and never came across an impact gun with this much power! I had half a dozen other guns in my box, and gave them to my kids to beat on. This is the only one I'll use now. I plan on getting the rest of the line very soon.
customer_reviews.author: paulG

customer_reviews.title: Good Impact.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work and am happy with it. It keeps up with the more expensive brand impacts that we use. It is very comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Good Gun
customer_reviews.text: Worked amazing for about a year. Lost its balls but still works. Probably my fault from the not so clean shop I work in. Had this happen to my other aircat as well. Sent it in and they found dirt in regulator. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Still early, but what a hammer!
customer_reviews.text: I fought with some large seized bolts for 3 days before I bought this. Tried PB Blaster, breaker bar with cheater pipe, torch, Makita impact, and even friends who thought I was just a whimp...lol! The NitroCat made us all look foolish without a sweat!
customer_reviews.author: Babydaddy

customer_reviews.title: Love at first impact
customer_reviews.text: As a weekend DIYer, I love this tool. It's increased my productivity and speed.
customer_reviews.author: PaulRH

customer_reviews.title: My first time using this tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air impact two months ago. Yesterday I got to use it. I removed the wheel lugs and 3/4" rusty nuts from the axle mounts to relocate the trailer axle 8" forward. It worked good but I need to try it on something bigger.
customer_reviews.author: R. R. H.

customer_reviews.title: good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Good: Makes great power Quiet light cheep Not as good: leaks oil where you put the socket on after 6 months of daily use Replacement parts take long time to git. Bought this used from Warehouse deals used, they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Sam & Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: My best air tool purchase to date
customer_reviews.text: My best air tool purchase to date. This thing works circles around the harbor freight tool I had. I use this when working on my F250HD and it makes short work of the large, rusted bolts on this rig.
customer_reviews.author: jedg

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of torque
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of torque. I had purchased the Aircat 1150 and was disappointed with the torque. Returned the 1150 and purchased this one and I am very pleased with the torque. Removed lug nuts on my 3/4 ton Silverado with plenty of power to spare. I am glad I made this purchase and returned the 1150.
customer_reviews.author: csp

customer_reviews.title: Strong, lighweight, and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I work as a diesel mechanic. Don't confuse the light weight and quietness for lack of power. I have taken off wheel nuts that were installed using a 1" gun to 550 ft-lbs on max with no problems. I have taken off nuts that my shop's noisy IR gun couldn't take off.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: so good. I bought this to pop some bolts loose ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I bought this to pop some bolts loose on my tractor wheels, and it did the trick where a 4 foot lever didn't. Haven't put a lot of cycles on it yet, but I like what I see so far.
customer_reviews.author: jtodd

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It works great for work ! Havent had a problem
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Not a SnapOn but it’s about the next best 1/2 inch impact I have.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thilges

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any Mechanic of any level.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do a rear axle swap in my pickup. Worked really great. My hands are not sore from beating on my breaker bar trying to loosen old rusted on bolts. Now I just need a bigger compressor.
customer_reviews.author: mkjprice

customer_reviews.title: This impact is awesome. Its comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I spent alot of time deciding this impact. Did tons of research and tested a bunch of other impacts: IR's, matco, snapon, harbor freight. This impact is awesome. Its comfortable, not too loud and most importantly powerful. Crankshaft bolts, no problem. Rusted 40 yr old bed bolts on my dodge, no problem. Really impressed especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great For Flat Rate Techs
customer_reviews.text: I work as a technician at a shop I work on underbody, frame and a lot of big lugs and it's worked perfectly as it should. My head tech has one of these from 3 years ago that still works perfectly. 100% worth the money over any snap-on, Matco or Earthquake impacts for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best one I ever own
customer_reviews.text: Best one I ever own. Grew up with families being construction and mechanic. This air impact wrench is champ no discuss.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace III

customer_reviews.title: Kinda bulky but good price:quality ratio
customer_reviews.text: Good little impact for the money. My IR2135ti (not max) has much better torque and power despite this ones ratings but I can buy 4 of these at this price and this one still gets the job done with less noise.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love ot
customer_reviews.text: Great torque and lightweight, relatively quite, especially compared to my 25 year old air wrench that so retired after this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: power is over rated.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, handles well. Does not have the power of my old I.R. though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: My favorite impact. Its very powerful and quiet with its ...
customer_reviews.text: I had enough aircat 1000 and am a mechanic and used this tool hard every day for about 7 years till it quit. Now I have the nitrocat 1200 and am back in business. My favorite impact. Its very powerful and quiet with its own unique sound, and is light weight. I will never put any other 1/2 in. Drive impact in my toolbox only aircat for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice study airgun very powerful it meet myexpectations I will ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice study airgun very powerful it meet myexpectations I will have rated 5 start but is a bit to big nice to work on big truck it remove big bolts and I meant like semi trucks lug nuts the are torque to 550 foot pounds this is a real good purchase compare to SNAP ON or IR I own both but this gun is nice to own you need to be careful using it it's quiet and you can brake the bolts or strip them ......
customer_reviews.author: Omar Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Good gun, but be careful.
customer_reviews.text: I love how the gun works, but recently after having it for a year and a half my anvil broke right off, I am pretty sure it is still under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have had it for about a year now and still ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for about a year now and still hits hard and I use it almost daily. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: air pack wrench
customer_reviews.text: this was a Christmas present for my son ....he uses it every day at work. he is an auto mechanic....great product
customer_reviews.author: Jim Warren

product_meta.title: NitroCat 1200-K 1/2-Inch Kevlar Composite Air Impact Wrench With Twin Clutch Mechanism
product_meta.description:
Size:full sizeThe AIRCAT 1200-K is a 1/2" Impact with a Kevlar housing and is part of our Nitro Cat brand of impacts. It produces 1295 ft-lbs of loosening torque using a smooth twin clutch hammer mechanism. It's designed for breaking loose tough bolts on heavy duty truck shops. There several patents on the 1200-K. Patented ergonomic handle for user comfort. Patented quiet tuned exhaust lowering the noise to 86 dB. Patented forward/ reverse lever. Other Specs as follows. Requires a minimum of 8 CFM at 90 PSI measured at the air inlet while the trigger is fully engaged to operate properly. Minimum hose size is 3/8". It has a 2 year .

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The AIRCAT 1200-K is a no non-sense, hard hitting 1/2-inch impact wrench that outperforms anything in its class! Used by many NHRA Top Fuel Race teams. All the power, half the noise! The AIRCAT tool line has a substantially reduced level of noise while retaining more power and torque. Our tools have been tested and shown to operate at 82-86 dBa (decibels), far below the OSHA guidelines. This feature benefits not only the mechanic but also the overall business. The patented tuned exhaust muffler technology, in all the tools, allows discharged air to pass without developing back pressure, thus retaining more power, while significantly reducing noise. AIRCAT has innovated through-the-handle exhaust design, which incorporates its revolutionary worldwide patented internal muffler/filter. The benefits include reduced hazards from breathing exhausted air particulates, the elimination of blow-by into the operators eyes and lungs as well as reduce noise. AIRCAT also incorporates a patented ergonomically engineered handle design to relieve stress and fatigue on the operators hands, wrists and arms. The patented AIRCAT handle offers better overall distribution of weight for a balanced tool and provides a unique grip that makes it easier to use for prolonged periods of time. AIRCAT offers a full line of pneumatic tools, including impact wrenches, air ratchets, reversible drills, die grinders, and cut-off tools. Established 1998 in Spokane, Washington AIRCAT is a line of high quality pneumatic hand tools that incorporates the unique and multi-patented exhaust muffler/filter technology. The AIRCAT tool line has a substantially reduced level of noise while retaining more power and torque. The AIRCAT impact wrench line offers both twin hammer and twin clutch mechanisms.
feature_bullets: Patented comfort grip, trigger and power management switch
Smooth twin clutch mechanism for breaking tough bolts loose
